*Please add a concise summary of your suggestion here.*

### Rationale
If spack is configured to use a repository with buildcache, and spack tries to install a package that is not in buildcache, the output is flooded with 404 errors when spack tries to download missing specks. E.g.: https://gist.github.com/iarspider/59c32adc9242a0a5355625bd34e2794a

All the 404 messages are only useful to a "buildcache maintainer", not to a "buildcache user". Can these be suppressed by default, and only shown if  "verbose" flag is passed to "spack install"?
title: Hide buildcache spec download errors
